website_summaries.verdict: A premium wooden marble run that's earned high praise and several awards for its ability to help develop STEM skills.
pros: Nurtures engineering skills and logical thinking
cons: Not compatible with other marble run sets

customer_reviews.title: Best marble run set on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best marble run set on the market by far. This set is amazingly high quality with perfect fitting pieces and great instructions. All of the kids (and adults) love it from 5yr - 9yr in our family. Our 9yr +7yr olds work together building and reading the directions and it's wonderful to see them work together. We tried another cheaper (1/3 price) marble set from another company and it's horrible compared to the Hape sets. Also, we purchased a basic wood block set and then we could make even crazier marble runs (see picture).
customer_reviews.author: BrendaAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great Marble Run
customer_reviews.text: We had gotten a plastic marble run as a gift and it was TERRIBLE! It was hard to put together and not intuitive at all. My four year old daughter LOVES this set. It came with a few suggested builds with easy to follow directions. We store it in a dresser drawer (in play space). For the block parts I use a plastic shoe bin and used a Sterilite Divided Case to organize the smaller parts and that works great!
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Now with plastic parts, not all wood
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying that we've had a couple versions of this marble run for a couple years and it is amazing. However, I just purchased this additional set to supplement the other sets we have and I'm very disappointed that the accelerators and purple blocks are now made of plastic and not wood. In the photos, the previous sets are on the right and the new set is on the left.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Prins

customer_reviews.title: Don’t touch!
customer_reviews.text: It looks like nice quality wood product that you would expect from Hape but you spend all this time following instructions to set up exactly right so the marbles actually go the right direction (if they even make it down) and if you accidentally touch it the whole thing comes crashing down. Definitely not for young children! Very disappointed in a product that I purchased over the “cheap plastic” type that is a waste of money! If it actually stays up the marbles don’t even make it down without help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son because he's into constructing things and loves to follow toy cars and trains go around the track, so I thought he would like this too. He's still a bit too young to assemble it on his own, but he still LOVES it. My husband and I had so much fun making different arrangements as well. This is definitely something we will be spending more of our weekends on and I hope to eventually add the other sets as our children get older.
customer_reviews.author: kjammer123

customer_reviews.title: Another great Quadrilla set
customer_reviews.text: Another great Quadrilla set. I don't think you can go wrong with these. We have minimal derailing with this set compared to what we had before. The kids don't even mind the derailing that does occur as it gives a great "thunk" sound when it drops onto the light table surface. Warning, the adults may end up playing after the kids are in bed. :-) Also, you'll probably end up wanting more sets. You can build a perfectly adequate marble run with a single set like this but bigger is always better!
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Satonica

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this toy at the very beginning of the coronavirus quarantine in 2020, and it has provided hours of enjoyment for my 6 and 2 year olds. We've tried making our own tracks, and we've searched online for ideas from other people. Will probably add another set to the Christmas list this year!
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: many missing pieces. Unusable!
customer_reviews.text: The product looks great quality BUT a lot of pieces are missing (see photo) rendering it completely unusable! Update: fantastic return process (drop off at Kohls), and received new box (all pieces this time!) 1.5 day later. I’ve changed my initial 1 star rating to 4. Will update once the kids start playing after Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Falls over easily
customer_reviews.text: Structures require ~ 10 min to build (if not interrupted by children) but then fall down easily when bumped accidentally - which happens a lot. My kids are 4 and 7 and both knocked over a structure in the half hour we played with it this morning. Seems like you need to be older than the target audience to be able to use the set (e.g. Not knock it over) without frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Arraway

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all--constant collapsing tower and rebuilding.
customer_reviews.text: I initially liked the color and design of the toy. However, once I built the first small marble run (not nearly as big as the ones pictured) I realized how unstable the marble tower is. Every time I or my child slightly touched the tower, it would collapse. It was very frustrating having to constantly rebuild it. I have the Hape dollhouse and was hoping for the same durability as it. For the price, I expected more stability.
customer_reviews.author: Andria

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our 6 year old, but our soon to be 10 year old and the 11 year old have a ton of fun with this as well. This is WAY better than the junky plastic ones you get that barely fit together and break so easily. Well made and worth the money. The only complaint would be that once you make a set they do get very easily knocked over. Just a small bump sends it falling down like dominos but it kind of works out because the kids don't mind trying something new anyway most of the time. I wouldn't count on keeping it up though! Stores nicely in the box it comes in
customer_reviews.author: crystalj

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I had my eye on this for so long and wanted to get it but the price held me back. It was the deal of the day one day and I decided to jump on it. I’m glad I didn’t pay full price because it’s not as exciting as I thought. The red ramp pieces don’t stay in place and the teeter totter is useless. It also doesn’t leave a lot of room for creativity. Honestly I was a bit disappointed since Hape in general is very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: jessie

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This is terrible you set it up and barely bump it and the entire thing falls down. I bought one from Lakeshore learning for $40 100 pieces and it is awesome! 4 options and does not fall over. Buy that one. I wish I could return this bit too much time has passed
customer_reviews.author: mollykm

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old son loves it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good as long as an adult plays with him because it easily collapses but he loves the freedom to build it. I see this toy lasting for a long time and maybe he can pass it on to his kids. He also has the Discovery one as well and loves that as well because it doesn't break easily but he enjoys building the hape more because of more pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so things can get knocked over easily. Its not an enjoyable activity
customer_reviews.text: It keeps our whole family (husband, wife, 7-year old and 4-year old) engaged for a long time when we are able to maintain positive attitudes and persevere in designing a working track from top to bottom. Its very fragile though, so things can get knocked over easily. Its not an enjoyable activity, however, when nerves are raw.
customer_reviews.author: lucie

customer_reviews.title: and can easily topple over
customer_reviews.text: The designs definitely required an adult and a bit of patience. The pieces fit well together, but they are just cradled into each other, and can easily topple over. I also feel the marble tray should be included, I shouldn't have to purchase it separately.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Chin

customer_reviews.title: Super fun
customer_reviews.text: It's a little complex for our four year old to build the way it is intended but he finds his own way to build and us adults remain engaged with it as well. Plenty of pieces to build something complex and good instructions and examples to get familiar with how the different pieces work.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 4 year old grandson who,loves it. It’s a bite complicated for him to setup but he is getting the hang of it by exploration....trial and error. This will be a great problem solving toy that he will use for a long time. It’s very sturdy and well made. Very glad we bought this for him.
customer_reviews.author: Candelkracht

customer_reviews.title: Best for an older child
customer_reviews.text: Fun, well made set! This is a great marble set, includes many pieces and fun to construct. However, I bought this for a 5 year old and each piece is designed to send the marble a specific way. They have to be assembled by someone who has an understanding of momentum and can easily figure out where each piece needs to be placed for the marble to make it from start to end. My son isn't quite old enough to play with this alone. I'd say a child over the age of 10 would be best suited for a marble set like this.
customer_reviews.author: amymichb24

customer_reviews.title: Not as environmentally friendly as I was led to believe.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because(aside from a few small ramps and plugs) it was completely made of wood. This is a great product and its advertised as being environmentally friendly. Ends up that the purple spacers are plastic, really disappointed. I adore that the packaging was all cardboard. C'mon Hape, I would have happily paid a bit more to have this toy as it was.
customer_reviews.author: Red Cooks

customer_reviews.title: Easy to manipulate to match things up and/or change courses
customer_reviews.text: High quality, as expected. Easy to manipulate to match things up and/or change courses. Happy it comes with a manual for different configurations when creativity isn't truly there. Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: C3O

customer_reviews.title: Great building project
customer_reviews.text: This is a very impressive looking marble run, the colors are vibrant and the configurations are sophisticated. Aside from it not coming with marble catchers, my complaint is that it only takes a tap and it collapses. With a 3 year old who demands to be part of it, it doesn't stay standing for long. Even a careless movement from an adult will bring it down. Otherwise, it would be a solid 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: JNR

customer_reviews.title: Parts missing in box
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived to us with all the little parts missing - the ones that make it actually work. In total it was missing 64 little components (3 different types). We ordered it way in advance of a Birthday so by the time we opened it to find out the pieces were missing, it was too late to return it. I'm not sure if the manufacturer forgot to include all the parts, or if it was returned to Amazon with parts missing and then Amazon shipped it back out. Either way, it is obsolete without all the parts, and the parts cannot be ordered separately, which means we cannot even use it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kay

customer_reviews.title: The older one remade the structure in several different configurations and they both loved feeding the marbles in and watching them go
customer_reviews.text: My grandsons 5 and 3 years old, stayed with us for 10 days and had a ball playing with this. The older one remade the structure in several different configurations and they both loved feeding the marbles in and watching them go. The pieces are well constructed out of quality materials. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Merry1

customer_reviews.title: Great toy with kids
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Sturdy and solid pieces. Must be on solid and level ground for a good playing experience. My 3 year old loves it but he is too young to build anything alone. This requires someone older to help build. Easy to follow instructions. There is nothing to catch the marbles once they run through the maze which is annoying. Overall a great product. I bought 2.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun, until it falls over.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun marble run. The instructions come with 2 designs. I wish it came with more, but the instructions are easy to follow. The pieces are sturdy and well made. Once it’s built though, it’s not very stable. The kids easily knock it over.
customer_reviews.author: Rcoletti116

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: I bought my 5 year old son this marble run for Christmas and the whole family loves it. Many different combinations, easy to put together and disassemble. Sometimes the balls get stuck on the track but its probably just because we put too many on at once. Super entertaining - even the cats like it
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M

customer_reviews.title: Marble Railway in Wood
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my 4 year old grandson who was delighted with it. It required some assistance to construct but he is getting the hang of it now. It continues to delight him. I think it is a delightful toy which requires some patience and focus. Altogether a good learning and enjoyment toy. I would recommend it to anyone with a curious young child.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: well built and good value
customer_reviews.text: Have loved marble runs since I was a child and this one is awesome. I challenge my kids to take the parts I give them and make a run that works. They were a little overwhelmed at first by the amount of pieces in this kit, but I started slow and now they challenge each other. Definitely recommend buying this AND the marble catchers (sold separately).
customer_reviews.author: Diane Calloway

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this marble track! My 4 year old wouldn't stop playing with it all day!
customer_reviews.author: Jsmith

customer_reviews.title: Good toy but easy to knock over
customer_reviews.text: This is fun and my kids liked playing with it but it is VERY easy to know over so make sure it is ok a flat surface and the children playing with it are old enough to know to be careful not to knock it over
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: Great learning toy and super fun for kids and parents. Easy enough for our 4yr old to assemble with help. Gave 3 stars for stability because it is easily knocked over if bumped (parts do not snap together).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, fun and versatile!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this track for a few years. The kids love building and playing with this. The pieces have held up nicely over the years. The quality is great! The pieces have a nice weight and feel, and the colors are vibrant. If you bump into the track, it will fall over. This can be frustrating with smaller kids, or if you have a dog who likes to be in the middle of things. This toy has been consistently played with for years, it is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: buddy

customer_reviews.title: Not for smaller children
customer_reviews.text: This is really, really fun but easily loses it's balance. If you want children to play with it, it needs to be glued. Unfortunately you need to buy marble catchers (a lot) to use it effectively. As an adult, I had a ball trying to figure out how to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie B. Palmieri

customer_reviews.title: Kids put down their electronics for this
customer_reviews.text: My six year old has played with this several times since we got it at Christmas. He likes designing his own roller coasters on Minecraft so I was looking for something hands on. The whole family enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Nonymous

customer_reviews.title: Fun, creative and a crowd pleaser
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this set and another different one for twin boys aged 4 1/2 and it was a real hit. There are thousands of combinations to be made and the instructions are clear and easy to follow. Would suggest a supporting hard surface under the construction as it can be a little tippy, especially for younger children. Looking forward to many hours of entertainment with this toy. Much better than any of the cheaper plastic versions. Well worth the $.
customer_reviews.author: R1Z2

customer_reviews.title: I like the look
customer_reviews.text: I like the look, the different runs you can build, the wood and the colors. However, once set up, if you bump any part of the run, the whole thing comes tumbling down. If you have children who are naturally uncoordinated or clumsy, this is not the marble run for you. Find a set that snaps in place, locks, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Huge box not as specified on Amazon site
customer_reviews.text: Box dimensions are much bigger than the specifications on Amazon site. So big it’s not possible to take on the plane or in the luggage
customer_reviews.author: OD

customer_reviews.title: It gets some time to make it right but then, AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: It's gonna take some time to know which piece does what do I can build it by memory and create my own structure but after following meticulously the manual it is awesome, my 2 and 4 years old LOVE it. But there is now way, at that ages, they could build a structure by themselves. For now I build, they play:)
customer_reviews.author: Lili

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. My 5 year old loves it. There’s an easy set up option that he does himself. Then there’s the multiple tiers that take longer to set up but fun to play with when done.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A. Arechiga

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: A really fun concept. It works great when put together but I wish it was a bit more interlocking. The slightest movement will crash the entire set down.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Great marble run!
customer_reviews.text: This marble run is so fun to play with!! The directions included showed us just how to build it and it works great! I love the mostly wood construction as well.
customer_reviews.author: N Minshew

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy as it seems
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted my son to like this because he loves marbles, but even at age 11 he has a hard time putting it together and keeping it from falling over. He never plays with it and for the amount of money it costs that makes me sad. I keep hoping and will keep trying to get him to enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Donna McPherson

customer_reviews.title: topples way too easily.
customer_reviews.text: this was really great until it would not stop falling down - no matter where it was set up. frustrating and expensive toy.
customer_reviews.author: Fredmac

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. My 5 year old is a marble run ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. My 5 year old is a marble run connoisseur and he said this is the best one ever. Quality materials, everything runs smoothly and it came with a ton of marbles. Assembled in several different ways, hours of fun. I don't ever write reviews but this deserves the best. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: MBender

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend this toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality product that will entertain elementary aged kids for hours. It can be modified and rebuilt many different ways and can be added on to and/or linked with other sets. It is definitely the kind of toy that could be passed down or used in a school setting. Smart, creative, durable and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: N. Gillispie

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. Every penny.
customer_reviews.text: My son, husband and I all love this construction toy. Well made, stimulating to children and adults alike. The colors are bright, the constructions suggestions and diagrams are specific and there is freedom to construct in anyway you like after you get the basics! Per my son" I just like it because it is like a stream." He is fascinated with all things stream like and gravity and so forth and this toy answers that need for him to explore those forces of nature
customer_reviews.author: El Tipo Respeta

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR ANY CHILD. GREAT GIFT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Building for days , great for any child or fun adult!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Valdez

customer_reviews.title: reconfigurable, fun for parents and kids, does collapse easily
customer_reviews.text: Fun for the whole family. I can't decide if my husband or my 3 yr old daughter likes it better. There are many interesting configurations you can come up with. The only catch is that the pieces don't "snap" into place, just rest on each other so it can be knocked down easily. After a few times my daughter tries to be careful with our masterpiece.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Rinat Bitton

customer_reviews.title: Great marble run!
customer_reviews.text: This marble run is awesome! My kids are on the young side of suitable for it (5 &3), so they need help building the runs, but once I build something they go to town. Grandma likes to play with it, mommy and daddy like to play with it, older cousins like to play with it. I would buy this again and again.
customer_reviews.author: bocolopo

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: So many options will provide hours of fun for your child and you. Love that it wood and not plastic. Definitely one of toys that will be passed down.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D

customer_reviews.title: Fun wholesome imaginative play
customer_reviews.text: Absolute hit with the niece and nephew this Christmas, they play with it a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Schoenau

customer_reviews.title: Unique, classic gift
customer_reviews.text: My kids (ages 7 and 9) love this! Every kid aged two to twelve that we have shared this with has loved it too! Wish the pieces locked in place better, but still one of the best toy investments we have made. Amazon had way cheaper prices than our local stores. Looking forward to adding pieces to this cool toy.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: One of our favorite toys for both 3 and 10 year old
customer_reviews.text: One of our favorite toys for both 3 and 10 year old! So many diff ways to build and the product will last years. Ditch the plastic marble runs for this one!
customer_reviews.author: Jackelin

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Box was missing eight pieces needed to block holes in the runs, so could not make the design as pictured, and limits other possible designs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just okay
customer_reviews.text: This is nicely made. The directions show large images of how the pieces fit together. It just did not hold the interest of all my kids as it is easy to knock over It can be very frustrating for the older kids putting together especially with younger ones around that just want to help. I think I will do as another reviewer had stated and put this on my coffee table for adult visitors to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Well likely get some additional sets like the musical one to go with this
customer_reviews.text: It's not something my 5 and 7 year old take out every day but it's a big hit when it does come out. Well likely get some additional sets like the musical one to go with this.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, hours of fun, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing toy. My nephew has HOURS of fun with this and loves setting it up both following the instructions and freely creating new mazes. I highly recommend this for a stimulating interaction play time.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic. Another Hape winner!
customer_reviews.text: Both our 3 yr old and our 5 year old love this toy. Adults got in on the fun too! Well constructed. Lots of different configurations. One of the best toys we bought in the last 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: RMiller

customer_reviews.title: great well made toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy is well made and keeps my sons (4 and 2) entertained for quite a while. The marbles get lost quite quickly so I should have purchased th marble catcher thing, so they don't roll everywhere and get lost.
customer_reviews.author: X. Mao

customer_reviews.title: Best Marble Run EVER! ok we only have this one, but we still love it.
customer_reviews.text: When my 4yo daughter asked for this toy, I was not terribly surprised as this is right up her alley, but I was not excited because she has two younger siblings who aren't all that trustworthy and quite a bit more destructive. I tried to encourage a less complicated marble run, but it was a no-go. Santa decided I was wrong and brought it anyhow. Let me tell you, this thing is awesome!!! Do I have to be a dictator with marble distribution to ensure my baby doesn't swallow them? Yes...but I do it, because everyone, and I mean everyone loves this thing. I highly recommend this hape toy!
customer_reviews.author: Zach & Amber

customer_reviews.title: gift
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my grand daughter. She liked it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: jacquie cruz

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Looks great but its missing pieces!! It was a gift from santa and the kids were a bit disappointed they couldn’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Best marble run yet. And we have tried several.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it it keeps him busy for hours
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Strickland

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Marble Run
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. Great quality and fun. Our 4 year old can't build it be loves to roll the marbles once completed. Our 7 year old can build his own creations. We have 2 sets of Hape runs so lots of pieces to make creative runs.
customer_reviews.author: Jen_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Best set
customer_reviews.text: Great quality- we have tried a lot of marble tracks- this one was the best so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Wood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Best toy I have purchased for My 4YO lately. Well packed, well constructed, durable, didactic and fun. Very unique.
customer_reviews.author: ok

customer_reviews.title: just what I expected
customer_reviews.text: the only problem I had was the rocker didn't rock when the marble or marbles entered it . other than that nice product
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: It falls down way too easy.
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea but wrong for the little ones. Easy to knock down by accidental little hands. When up it is fun but rarely stays up long with the kids it was designed for.
customer_reviews.author: craig bur***

customer_reviews.title: Nice game, but wait till the kids are older ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice game, but wait till the kids are older for this one. Way too much intensity for a smart 5 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Mary R

customer_reviews.title: Great set, difficult for 6 year olds.
customer_reviews.text: Grand Kids, age 6, struggled to keep focused with building this set. Unfortunately they wanted immediate results. Hopefully the coming months will show better acceptance of it as they grow older.
customer_reviews.author: Kechiken

customer_reviews.title: My kids (ages 5 & 7) absolutely adorable this marble run
customer_reviews.text: My kids (ages 5 & 7) absolutely adorable this marble run. It's fun, well built, and great for thinking while playing. Ours is set up on my kid's train table, and it's the perfect height. I recommend getting the marble catchers too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works well & high quality but falls apart VERY easily. Just isn’t sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: Turns out to be more for me than the kids...
customer_reviews.text: I love it...the cats a little too much. My kids aren't interested in building it (which is super annoying), but I'm happy to steal their present :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy and very high quality
customer_reviews.text: The Quadrilla - Vertigo - Marble Railway is a great toy that is fun for adults and children. I got it for my twin grandgirls, who are eight. They both love it and we really enjoy building the various designs. The directions are very well done. Step by step pictures. Great toy to get your child to follow directions. This is a high quality tool that will last gernerations! John
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John A. Barnshaw III

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good enough to play with my boy. but you might need more stuff. only one is not enough!
customer_reviews.author: plux001

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: You have to pay attention to how you assemble this but it’s pretty easy to figure out and the kids and the husband love it. Hours of play.
customer_reviews.author: ryan warren

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: My son just opened the box and we are missing the 50 marbles and bag as well as the 14 red "sliders". To say I am disappointed in an understatement.
customer_reviews.author: JKPP04

customer_reviews.title: Love this marble run
customer_reviews.text: Love this marble run! Great for a four year old who loves to build. I appreciated the instructions for some configurations,just to get you started. My husband loves this too!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Edeen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great item for a 6 year old. It can be constructed in several different designs.
customer_reviews.author: Bernice J Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: Best Marble runs!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this one, and so do I! It's really fun building it together! My son is 5 years old, and he needs some help on putting it all together, but after few times building together, he found where and how to put the block together. It's very good quality! Best marble runs!
customer_reviews.author: SmileJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing toy, my grandson loves it and his dad ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing toy, my grandson loves it and his dad is a tech person so he changes the design frequently so toy doesn't get old! Only thing I could say is it would be better if the pieces interlocked because his masterpiece gets knocked over frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Walton

customer_reviews.title: To advanced for a 4 year old
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing toy, very clever and fun! But it's listed for 4 years and up. This toy is NOT for 4 year olds! The instruction diagrams are complicated for an adult. Although I still give it high marks because I think my child will grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: J Fox

customer_reviews.title: My son loves marble runs. So we have a ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves marble runs. So we have a few different ones. Even though this is expensive it is worth it. It is very high quality and will last generations for your family. It will be something your little ones will be able to play with their little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Happy mommy

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: The marble run is without a doubt the favorite toy in our house. It has provided hours of fun and exploratory play. I wish Hape made more pieces--more ramps and bells. Overall, just a beautifully and thoughtfully designed toy!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: must have level floor/don't loose any pieces/not for young kids
customer_reviews.text: product requires a perfectly level floor for run to work, which apparently none of the 3 floors in 2 different appartments we tried it on are. also, the loss of 1 of the smallest purple pieces renders some of the patterns impossible to build. I am very suspect of the many positive reviews. For this high price, there should be a few extra pieces and the company should warn customers if it a only slightly unl-evel floor makes the toy not work. finally, while the adds show young kids using it, really kids of 3-5 need lots of help building it and frequently knock parts of it over when loading marbles. not really for kids as young as they advertise.
customer_reviews.author: Jerermy

customer_reviews.title: How can I replace broken pieces?!?
customer_reviews.text: 2 pieces broke and it is unclear how to replace them. Otherwise I would give this a 5 but for the cost there needs to be a option to replace individual pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy - topples easily
customer_reviews.text: Not sturdy, especially when building vertically. Additionally, the marbles do not flow through smoothly - especially on the spiral tracks.
customer_reviews.author: Krunchie

customer_reviews.title: No longer solid wood
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, some pieces are now plastic where it was all once wooden. My boys still love it and it gets played with all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Shane and Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: My two year old loves this! Have to watch her with marbles but it's easy to set up and there's so many ways to do it. It falls down easy, but she finds that fun too.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A Burleson

customer_reviews.title: Too complex for him to build on his own but we enjoy building it together
customer_reviews.text: My mother bought it for my son's 4 year birthday. He loves it. Too complex for him to build on his own but we enjoy building it together. Of course it gets knocked down easily but him and his 2 year old sister but it is so sturdy I am not worried about anything breaking.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dang

customer_reviews.title: Super GREAT gift for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a really neat gift for the right age child. The product was pakaged in quality box and kids love it! Just has to be on a level surface! Great gift and would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Thumps Up!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year-old son plays with this daily. He loves to build his own tracks and figure out what happen if it doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Nobil

customer_reviews.title: Lot's of fun, good quality
customer_reviews.text: With the directions it's pretty easy to assemble, although too difficult for my 4 year old grandson. Good quality and good fun.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Both of my 5yr-old and 8yr-old LOVE it. If you see the price drops below 80, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Family Man

customer_reviews.title: Falls super easy
customer_reviews.text: Blocks fall by just breathing too hard on them! Is AWEFUL
customer_reviews.author: ivan m

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 5 year olds birthday. He loves it. Still can’t put it together himself but it doesn’t stop him for asking to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: ReneeWells

customer_reviews.title: but has too many small parts so its a little to tedious to put together
customer_reviews.text: My 7 yr old high functioning autistic child loves marble runs, but has too many small parts so its a little to tedious to put together.
customer_reviews.author: kwhite311

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is so fun! Our whole family enjoys building and playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: GrierP

product_meta.title: Hape Quadrilla Wooden Marble Run Construction - Vertigo - Quality Time Playing Together Wooden Safe Play - Smart Play for Smart Families,Multicolor
product_meta.description: Hape Quadrilla is a High Quality Wooden Marble Run Construction System. It provides QUALITY TIME for the whole family to play together. The BEST GIFT for your loved ones. It provides endless creative building possibilities and encourages spatial thinking and problem solving. Each of the seven different color blocks has a different function and it's the world's only kinetic marble run. Vertigo has won “Spiel Gut” (Good Toy) Award and Oppenheim Toy Portfolio Platinum Award. Providing over a thousand happy playing hours, Quadrilla is worth every penny. All Quadrilla marble run sets are crafted with heirloom quality birch and rubber wood for long-lasting marble racing fun. Hape Toy finishes are all non-toxic, child safe and of the highest quality. Hape constructs their toys using FSC accredited wood products. Hape toys stimulate children through every stage of development and help nurture and develop their natural abilities. All Hape products meet or exceed all applicable safety standards. A creative take on the marble run, the Quadrilla Vertigo provides a great mix of spins, drops, seesaws, and speed that will have marbles going every which way! Includes straightaway rails, three spiral funnels, and a seesaw for swift and exciting fun. As with every Hape Quadrilla Marble Run Construction Sets, it combines easily with other Hape Quadrilla products for expansion and unique combinations that will enhance your child's play experience.All Hape wooden toys are constructed from FSC-certified wood and finished with child-safe, non-toxic paints.
feature_bullets: Praised by the Wall Street Journal as one of the top toys to teach kids code and STEM principles
German Engineering Design Inspired by Da Vinci circles with Endless Creative Building Possibilites for Spatial Thinking Minds
Each of the Seven Different Color Blocks has a different Function - Fun practice for logical and engineering thinking
“Spiel Gut” (Good Toy) Award and Oppenheim Toy Portfolio Platinum Award Winner
Thousands of Happy Playing Hours - An Heirloom Toy Worth of Every Penny
